Order Code.S: Order for Goods on Approval or Inspection

Bill Type Code.F: Final bill - last bill when an account is closed
Bill Type Code.O: Information only - not used in calculations
Bill Type Code.W: Withdrawn bill - reverses a previous bill

Type of Change.005: REFRESH (complete report including some changes since the last transmission)

Transaction Code.0100: Complete transmission of Product Information File with products chained together
Transaction Code.0101: Update transmission of Product Information File with products chained together
Transaction Code.0102: Complete transmission of Product Information File with products linked together in a hierarchy
Transaction Code.0103: Update transmission of Product Information File with products linked together in a hierarchy
Transaction Code.0150: Complete transmission of Price Information File from supplier to customer
Transaction Code.0151: Update transmission of Price Information File from supplier to customer
Transaction Code.0152: Complete transmission of Price Information File sent from customer to supplier
Transaction Code.0153: Update transmission of Price Information File sent from customer to supplier
Transaction Code.0200: Complete transmission of Customer Information File
Transaction Code.0201: Update transmission of Customer Information File
Transaction Code.0205: Complete transmission of Location Information File
Transaction Code.0206: Update transmission of Location Information File
Transaction Code.0210: Complete transmission of Retailer Standing Database File
Transaction Code.0211: Update transmission of Retailer Standing Database File (Was previously issued as code 0206 in error)
Transaction Code.0215: Complete transmission of Retailer Database Report
Transaction Code.0216: Update transmission of Retailer Database Report
Transaction Code.0350: Proposed Orders planned orders which will subsequently be confirmed. Usually sent to help a supplier plan production.
Transaction Code.0355: Order for goods on approval/inspection - order for goods which may be returned after a period of inspection without being invoiced
Transaction Code.0360: Exceptions to Proposed Orders - changes to a previously sent proposed order, which could be made either by the customer or the supplier
Transaction Code.0365: Planning Orders - follow Proposed Orders and will subsequently be confirmed by the customer.  Used to show all lines with details of quantities required and delivery locations.  Intended to give a firm basis for the supplier to plan production and supplies.
Transaction Code.0400: Cancelled Orders - used to cancel outstanding orders.  These may originate either from the customer, when their requirements have changed, or the supplier if they cannot meet the order
Transaction Code.0405: Confirmation of Cancelled Orders - confirms that outstanding orders have been cancelled within the sender's system
Transaction Code.0410: Export Order - order placed on UK supplier for delivery overseas
Transaction Code.0420: Standing Order - an order for regular supplies, valid over a long term
Transaction Code.0430: New Orders - new order for goods and/or services
Transaction Code.0435: Order for retained approval goods - retrospective order to cover goods already received on approval/inspection when these are being retained
Transaction Code.0440: Order Amendment - contains changes to an outstanding order, such as quantities, prices and delivery dates.  To minimise transmission costs, only send the details for the products which have been amended.  Use transaction codes 0475 for re scheduled orders or transaction code 0485 for additional lines.  Note that order amendments can rarely be processed automatically.
Transaction Code.0445: Order Chaser - used to chase delivery of an outstanding order
Transaction Code.0450: Copy Orders - a copy of an order previously sent by EDI or other media.
Transaction Code.0460: Confirmation of Order by Ordering Company - used for example when an order is placed by telephone or fax
Transaction Code.0470: Mixed Order Types - the file contains a mixture of different types of order.  Each order should be processed according to the Order Code given in ORD ORCD.
Transaction Code.0475: Re-Scheduled Orders - used to change the delivery date of an order or order line. Only the lines which have been re-scheduled need be sent
Transaction Code.0480: Call-Off Orders - request for delivery against a contract, blanket or standing order
Transaction Code.0485: Addition to Existing Orders, Existing Requirements Unchanged - additional lines to be added to an outstanding order.  Only the new lines need be sent
Transaction Code.0490: Order Commitment - a contract to supply, not an instruction to deliver
Transaction Code.0500: Complete transmission of Hot Card File
Transaction Code.0501: Update transmission of Hot Card File
Transaction Code.0600: Delivery - a notification of delivery against an order, containing details of all the lines on the order.  Normally produced by the supplier once goods have been picked for that order
Transaction Code.0610: Consignment Note - sent by the supplier to the carrier to control the movement of a consignment through the distribution network to the customer
Transaction Code.0620: Instruction to Deliver - a request for a delivery to be made
Transaction Code.0630: Planned Delivery - used to report the status of a future delivery
Transaction Code.0640: Delivery Adjustment - a notification of changes to a delivery, used when amendments are made or requested after a proposed delivery or request to deliver has been sent
Transaction Code.0650: Balance - used to notify details of a part delivery when balances are accepted. Only includes those lines which are being delivered, not all the lines on the order, some of which may already have been received.
Transaction Code.0660: Proposed Delivery - advance notice of an impending delivery
Transaction Code.0670: Confirmation of Delivery - confirms the goods and quantities which have been delivered at a location
Transaction Code.0680: Confirmation of Despatch - confirms the goods and quantities which have been despatched to a location
Transaction Code.0690: Confirmation of Delivery Status Report - confirms the status of a delivery in preparation or transit
Transaction Code.0695: Warehouse Receipt - notification that goods have been received at a warehouse
Transaction Code.0700: Invoices Only - commercial document (sales invoice) issued by a supplier to a customer listing the goods or services supplied and stating the sum of money due. For ease of reconciliation it is recommended that one invoice relates to one order and/or one delivery.  Contains tax details where applicable.
Transaction Code.0701: Self Billed Invoices - commercial invoice raised by the customer based on the order placed, delivery received and the contract of supply
Transaction Code.0702: Retrospective Self-Billed Invoice - commercial invoice raised by the customer retrospectively
Transaction Code.0705: Factored Invoice - commercial invoice sent by a supplier to a factor who will be receiving the payment from the customer
Transaction Code.0707: Assigned Debt Invoice.  Used by sellers to send an invoice file via EDI to the buyers advising them that the debt has been assigned to the factoring company
Transaction Code.0709: Copy Invoice - not for VAT purposes.  Raised when copies of an invoice document are sent from one party to another by EDI for information purposes only.  The original invoice may have been sent by EDI or on paper.
Transaction Code.0710: Credit Claims (News trade) - claim for credit against unsold copies of a newspaper or magazine
Transaction Code.0711: Sales Report - not final claim for credit.  Report of sales of newspapers and magazines
Transaction Code.0715: Utility Bill - commercial invoice for metered services.  Contains tax details where applicable.
Transaction Code.0716: Copy Bill - not for VAT purposes.  Copy of a utility bill previously sent by EDI or other means.  For information purposes only.
Transaction Code.0717: Utility Credit Note - credit notes only
Transaction Code.0720: Debit Notes Only - notification of a sum or sums owing, raised by the debtor (customer).  Trading partners should agree whether this will contain VAT details, or whether the supplier will subsequently raise a Credit Note as the VAT document.
Transaction Code.0740: Credit Notes Only - notification of a sum or sums to be credited.  Usually sent by a supplier to a customer
Transaction Code.0741: Self Billed Credit Notes - a credit note raised by the customer based on information already known
Transaction Code.0742: Retrospective Self-Billed Credit Note - credit note raised by the customer retrospectively
Transaction Code.0749: Copy Credit Note - not for VAT purposes.  Copy of a credit note sent by EDI  or other means for information only
Transaction Code.0750: Provisional invoice, not valid for tax purposes. A periodic consolidated tax invoice must follow  (either EDI or paper document). (Was originally notified as 0711 in error)
Transaction Code.0820: Statement Details Only - list of credits and debits with the outstanding balance, sent either as a report or to request payment from the customer by the supplier
Transaction Code.0830: Remittance Details Only - details of the items against which a payment is being made.  Sent by the payer to the payee.
Transaction Code.0835: Payment Order - instruction on a bank to make a payment to a third party
Transaction Code.0840: Debit Advice - notification given by the bank to the payer to confirm that a payment has been, or will be, taken from their account
Transaction Code.0845: Credit Advice - notification given by the bank to the payee that a credit payment has been, or will be, made to their account
Transaction Code.0850: Exception - report from the bank to the payer that a problem has been identified with a payment
Transaction Code.0900: Uplift Notification - notification of a an uplift (collection) of goods which is being, or has been made
Transaction Code.0910: Planned Uplift - advance notification of an uplift (collection) of goods which is to be made
Transaction Code.0920: Uplift Confirmation - confirmation of the items and quantities which are being, or have been, uplifted
Transaction Code.0930: Confirmation of Uplift Status Report - report of the status of an uplift (collection) which is being, or is due to be, made
Transaction Code.1000: Picking Instructions Only - instructions on what to pick for an order or delivery
Transaction Code.1010: Picking Instructions Amendments - change to a picking instruction
Transaction Code.2000: Availability Report Only - report of actual or planned stock availability
Transaction Code.2100: Stock Snapshot Only - report of current stock holdings, usually sent by the stockholder to a supplier
Transaction Code.2200: Stock Adjustment Only - notification of adjustments to stock holdings, usually sent by a third party stockholder (eg a carrier) to the owner of the stock
Transaction Code.2300: Product Planning Report - planning report on products held at different locations
Transaction Code.2305: Location Planning Report -  report for locations holding various products
Transaction Code.3100: ** Acknowledgement that an Order has been received, with no further reference to the original purchase order line details.
Transaction Code.3110: Acknowledgement that an Order, with line details as shown, has been received, with no reference as to whether or not the supplier can meets its requirements
Transaction Code.3120: Acknowledgement, including expected delivery, for ALL lines ordered.
Transaction Code.3130: Acknowledgement, including expected delivery, for SOME lines ordered. Assumes the remaining lines will be, or have been, acknowledged separately. (Not used by EDICUG)
Transaction Code.3140: Acknowledgement providing expected delivery information ONLY for those lines where the Supplier cannot meet the requested delivery date(s).  Assumes the lines not included will be delivered as requested.  (Not used by EDICUG)
Transaction Code.3145: ** Acknowledgement of order not able to be supplied.  Query outstanding on customer account.  No reference is made to the order line details
Transaction Code.3150: Acknowledgement changing details which have previously been advised, eg. change in Date, Quantity, Price, etc.  All details for a line must be shown, including those which have not changed
Transaction Code.3160: ** Acknowledgement category NOT defined.  Will be used where the supplier's system does not have inbuilt indicators
Transaction Code.3170: ** Acknowledgement that a request to cancel an order has been received and actioned. No reference is made to the order line details.(Not used by EDICUG)
Transaction Code.3180: Acknowledgement that an order has been received and that stock has been allocated to all lines. ** 3100, 3145, 3160 and 3170 can also be used in ACKMNT segment AOR if no line details are being sent
Transaction Code.3200: Claims Acknowledgement (News trade) response to a claim for credit, indicating which claims have been accepted or rejected
Transaction Code.6000: Equipment Movement Confirmation - confirms the transfer of an item of equipment
Transaction Code.6001: Pallet Exchange Note - notification that pallets have been, or are to be exchanged. These may be either full or empty pallets.  Used when different types of pallet movements are being recorded (ie mixed file type).
Transaction Code.6002: Pallet Control Voucher - control document issued when goods have been delivered on pallets and no empty pallets were available for exchange.
Transaction Code.6003: Pallet Issue Note - notification that fresh pallets have been, or are to be issued. May also be used when goods on pallets have been recalled.
Transaction Code.6004: Pallet Return Note - notification that pallets have been, or are to be returned
Transaction Code.6005: Pallet Transfer Note - record of, or request for transfer of pallets
Transaction Code.6006: Pallet Query Note - request for information on the status of pallet movements. Used when no empty pallets or control vouchers were received.
Transaction Code.6007: Pallet Return Advice Note - notification that returns have been made
Transaction Code.6008: Pallet Ex Factory Movement - record of pallet transfers out of a factory.  Pallets may be empty or full.
Transaction Code.6009: Pallet Collection Request - request for pallets to be collected/uplifted
Transaction Code.6010: Load Collection Request - request for goods to be collected/uplifted
Transaction Code.9000: Issues (News trade) - master file showing details of the current issues of a magazine or newspaper, with selling restrictions
Transaction Code.9005: Supply and Returns (News trade) - report of the number of copies of an issued newspaper or magazine which have been sold or remain unsold
Transaction Code.9010: Dye Order - order for special textile dying and finishing operations
Transaction Code.9011: Return Dye Instruction - accompanies the returned dyed and finished items
Transaction Code.9020: Complete transmission of Price and Availability Update File
Transaction Code.9021: Update transmission of Price and Availability Update File

Transaction Type.CA: Confirmation of Delivery; Delivery to Customer (used with TCDE 0620)
Transaction Type.CB: Confirmation of Delivery; Internal Company Movement Out (used with TCDE 0620)
Transaction Type.CC: Confirmation of Delivery; Returns to Client (used with TCDE 0620)
Transaction Type.CD: Confirmation Proposed Delivery; Receipt from Supplier (used with TCDE 0660)
Transaction Type.CE: Confirmation Proposed Delivery; Internal Company Movement In (used with TCDE 0660)
Transaction Type.DA: Instruction to Deliver; Delivery to Customer (used with TCDE 0620)
Transaction Type.DB: Instruction to Deliver; Internal Company Movement Out (used with TCDE 0620)
Transaction Type.DC: Instruction to Deliver; Returns to Client (used with TCDE 0620)
Transaction Type.DD: Proposed Delivery; Receipt from Supplier (used with TCDE 0660)
Transaction Type.DE: Proposed Delivery; Internal Company Movement In (used with TCDE 0660)
Transaction Type.UPDATE-CUS: Update to existing Customer Information File (TCDE 0201)
Transaction Type.UPDATE-PRI: Update to existing Price Information File (TCDE 0151)
Transaction Type.UPDATE-PRO: Update to existing Product Information File (TCDE 0101 and 0103)
Transaction Type.CONF-ORDERS: Confirmation of Order by Ordering Company (TCDE 0460)

Measure Indicator.ZZ: Undefined - only used in intermediate stages of a calculation
Measure Indicator.TMHH: Therms per hundreds of cubic feet

Order Classification.R: Request (special customer order for items not usually stocked)

Registered Text Code.047: Paragraph within Conditions of Sale or Purchase to which particular attention is drawn for this Order
Registered Text Code.048: Rate of Duty Pay Back applicable for this sale ordered item
Registered Text Code.058: Stock Point (physical segregation of stock where location is not necessarily holder's warehouse)
Registered Text Code.059: Collecting Depot (where Depot receiving refused goods is different to that from which they were delivered)
Registered Text Code.074: Manufacturer's Recommended Selling Price in quoted currency, shown with 2 decimal places implicit
Registered Text Code.075: Net Book Price in quoted currency, shown with 2 decimal places implicit
Registered Text Code.076: Consignee's Order Number where a delivery/uplift is a relationship between a Carrier and a Retailer/Manufacturer, this element pertains to the order number supplied to the Retailer/Manufacturer by the end Customer
Registered Text Code.077: Goods Exchange Reference when the uplift of faulty goods is done at the same time as the delivery of the replacements, the delivery and uplift are cross-referred to each other using the Goods Exchange Reference
Registered Text Code.078: Mail Order Publication Reference Reference to a particular publication eg. Autumn/Winter as opposed to Spring/Summer catalogue
Registered Text Code.086: Order Length Required These are order specific tolerances that British Steel customers will be required to specify when ordering standard sizes or lengths
Registered Text Code.087: Viewdata Stock Allocation Quantity Quantity of stock allocated to order by Philips "MOVIES" viewdata system
Registered Text Code.088: Diary Class For use with the diary of negotiated delivery dates
Registered Text Code.097: Settlement Terms This is the discount given when a customer pays within a set number of days.  It consists of a percentage and a number of days in three consecutive blocks of 8 digits.  Each block has 3 digit percentage integers, 2 decimal places and 3 digits for the number of days eg. 2.5% within 10 days = 00250010
Registered Text Code.100: Viewdata Stock Location Code - Format X(6)
Registered Text Code.101: Stock/Non Stock Order Indicator Suggested values: 1 = stock replenishment order;  2 = non-stock order to meet a specific requirement
Registered Text Code.102: Quality Assurance Order subject to QA procedures of the purchaser
Registered Text Code.103: Quality Assurance Purchaser's representative's release note to accompany the goods
Registered Text Code.104: Quality Assurance Test certificates to be provided
Registered Text Code.105: Quality Assurance Item(s) for use above 7 Bar
Registered Text Code.107: Name of Person to Whom Goods are to be Delivered
Registered Text Code.108: Retail Selling Price for a Product in an Order Line; field size 9(5), price in pence
Registered Text Code.109: Customer's Merchandise Department Department within the ordering company who are responsible for this product line.  The customer will advise the location code to be used
Registered Text Code.110: Goods Received Note Identity Number Format X(9)
Registered Text Code.111: Advice Note Number Format X(20) Used when number is larger than standard
Registered Text Code.112: Order Number for Self Billed Invoicing Format X(25) which is greater than the ORNO field
Registered Text Code.113: Quantity Supplied - format 9(6)V9(5), used with QTYI fields
Registered Text Code.114: Price per Unit - format 9(9)V9(2), used with AUCT
Registered Text Code.115: Original Unit Price - format 9(9)V9(2), used for retrospective price adjustments
Registered Text Code.116: Line Level Goods Value - format 9(9)V9(2), used with LEXC
Registered Text Code.117: Total Goods Value - format 9(11)V(2), used with LVLA
Registered Text Code.120: Date of Incident - the date on which the cause of the supply happened - format YYMMDD
Registered Text Code.121: Date of Insurance Renewal - format YYMMDD
Registered Text Code.122: Customer Registered for VAT Indicator - Value will be Y or N
Registered Text Code.123: Odometer Reading - records the mileage at the time of supply - format 9(8)
Registered Text Code.125: Warranty Number - this will record the warranty certificate number.  Format X(30)
Registered Text Code.126: Reason Code - format X(3).  This is the reason for doing the job on the vehicle, eg. radio replaced due to theft etc.
Registered Text Code.127: Action Code - format X(3).  This is the action taken eg. supply and fit, supply only, fit only, etc.
Registered Text Code.128: Country of Origin - use the 2 alpha ISO country codes found in the Trade Data Elements Directory (TDED) in code list 3207 (EDIFACT) : ISO Code List 3166
Registered Text Code.129: Data Source and Version Number Text
Registered Text Code.130: Contra Account, Short name - text The name of the company to whom the pallet is interchanged
Registered Text Code.133: Master Case Order quantity - this is the order line quantity expressed as a number of master shipping cases
Registered Text Code.134: TI Multiple - format 9(6).  This indicates the number of shipping cases per tier of a pallet for an order line/delivery note
Registered Text Code.135: HI Multiple - format 9(6).  This indicates the number of layers/tiers on the pallet
Registered Text Code.136: ANA Number Representing the Factor Involved in the Assigned Invoice - format 9(13)
Registered Text Code.137: Part Type - this enables the supplier to indicate the type of part supplied for onward billing
Registered Text Code.138: Contact Name at the Delivery Address - format maximum size X(35)
Registered Text Code.139: Style - format X(15).  Code describing the style of the article ordered, where the product code is not sufficient
Registered Text Code.140: Department Code - format X(4).  Company's own department code
Registered Text Code.141: Colour Description of the Product - format X(35)
Registered Text Code.144: House of Fraser Season Code - format X(1)
Registered Text Code.145: Customer's Telephone Number - format X(25) *INCREASED FROM 9(10)*
Registered Text Code.146: Documentation Requirements - This is specific to B&Q as it is a concatenated set of data, the detail of which is separated by a comma as a field separator.  Data will be sent in the following order: No. of Invoice Copies V 9(2) No. of Packing List Copies V 9(2) No. of GSP Form A V 9(2) No. of Certificates of Origin V 9(2) No. of Specification Sheets V 9(2) No. of Inspection Certificates V 9(2) No. of Clean 'Shipped on Board' B/L V 9(2) No. of CMR V 9(2) No. of Proof of Delivery Documents V 9(2) No. of Days Before ETA Documents Must Arrive V 9(2) If there is no data, the field will have a '0' between the commas
Registered Text Code.147: Letter of Credit Details - This is a concatenation of the: Letter of Credit No. - format V X(11) Letter of Credit Opened Date - format F 9(6) Letter of Credit Expiry Date - format F 9(6)
Registered Text Code.148: Shipment Details - This is a concatenation of the: Shipment Estimated Date of Departure - format F 9(6) Shipment Estimated Date of Arrival - format F 9(6)
Registered Text Code.149: Schedule for the delivery of an order line.  A concatenated field used to specify, as a string of data, the required date 9(6), and the required quantity. The required quantity is split into three sub-elements; the number of traded units 9(15), the total measure 9(10)V9(3) and the measure indicator X(6). The quantity fields become fixed length fields as there are no separator characters.
Registered Text Code.150: Supplying Branch Telephone Number The telephone number of the supplier's retail outlet, up to 9(11) (UK).
Registered Text Code.151: Vehicle Description: Text description of the vehicle. X(40)
Registered Text Code.152: Client's reference for the vehicle X(40).
Registered Text Code.154: Type of invoice indicator: Used by Fleetnet to indicate the type of service invoiced as each has separate processing rules. Codes for this agreed and maintained by the Fleetnet community.
Registered Text Code.155: *Coal or Coke Invoice indicator: format 9(1). Has the following values 1 = Coal, or 2 = Coke.* Haulier Code: format X(3)
Registered Text Code.156: Invoice or Adjustment Type: format 9(1) British Coal code list. Values are: 1 = Current Month Invoice 2 = Previous Month Supplementary Invoice Debit 3 = Previous Month Supplementary Invoice Credit 4 = Debit or Credit Adjustment 5 = Weekly Invoice 6 = Weekly Supplementary Invoice Debit 7 = Weekly Supplementary Invoice Credit 8 = Weekly Interim Invoice
Registered Text Code.157: Invoice Location Code: Format V X(13) British Coal location to which queries should be addressed
Registered Text Code.158: Consignee Name: Format X (40), Name of consignee. This may not be the same as the destination name
Registered Text Code.159: Destination Name: Format X (40), Name of destination
Registered Text Code.160: Method of Transport: Format X (2), British Coal codes RD = Road, RL = Rail, CN = Canal, OM = Other Methods
Registered Text Code.161: Customer code for consignee; Format X (14); Code allocated by customer
Registered Text Code.162: Method of Loading: Format X (3); British Coal code
Registered Text Code.163: BACS Reference: Format X (15): Reference allocated by BACS to a payment. Used in conjunction with Remittance Advices
Registered Text Code.174: Payment Method, Use bank standard codes
Registered Text Code.175: Payment Date, 9(6) YYMMDD. Date payment was transferred, if electronic, or will be raised if a cheque
Registered Text Code.176: Payment Reference, X (17), the number of the cheque or payment order
Registered Text Code.178: Months in service, 9(2), The number of months since the vehicle was taken onto a leasing scheme
Registered Text Code.179: Charge Type, Code given to define the type of charge, eg Contract Hire, Lease Rental etc.
Registered Text Code.180: Charge Period. Period to which a charge relates
Registered Text Code.181: Charge Comment X(40) Additional text information relating to the charge.
Registered Text Code.182: Concatenated Order Level Totals The totals to be separated by commas Format: 9(3)V9(3), 9(10)V9(2), 9(10)V9(2) Totals to appear in the order: Total Cubic Metres; Total Unit Cost; Total Cost
Registered Text Code.183: Final Delivery Indicator, Format: X(1) Value: 'Y' or 'N'
Registered Text Code.184: Serial Shipping Container Code, Format: 9(18) To identify individual pallets delivered
Registered Text Code.185: Number of Cases, Format: 9(5) To show number of cases on an individual pallet, which may differ from the standard number given in the original order
Registered Text Code.187: Substitute available marker, Format: X(1) Value: 'Y' or 'N'
Registered Text Code.188: Pressurised Systems Legislation: to indicate items for 2 to 7 bar use
Registered Text Code.189: Pressurised Systems Legislation: to indicate items for use below 2 bar
Registered Text Code.190: Cause of problem code The Registered Text field following the code can be used to insert the actual cause of the problem.  Format X(40)
Registered Text Code.191: Contractor's Name The name of the contractor who has completed the work on a vehicle which is then being invoiced to a contract hire company and then re-invoiced to the operating company.
Registered Text Code.192: Contractor's Town Town where the work was carried out
Registered Text Code.193: Voucher Date Date on which the Fleetcard Voucher was completed. Format: 9(6) YYMMDD
Registered Text Code.194: Transaction Reference Reference relating to the original work carried out
Registered Text Code.195: Amended line code Generic code to identify the field(s) which have been amended, ie. change in quantity or price, on an Order or Complex Order amendment message. To aid automatic processing of messages received. The Registered Text field following the code to be used to detail the amendment in plain text for manual processing
Registered Text Code.196: Total Ordered Lines Product lines called off on Picking List Format: 9(10)
Registered Text Code.197: Total Ordered Quantity Quantity called off on Picking List Format: 9(15)
Registered Text Code.198: Total Received Lines Product lines booked in at warehouse.  Format: 9(10)
Registered Text Code.199: Total Received Quantity - Quantity booked in at warehouse Format: 9(15)
Registered Text Code.200: In-store price Selling price of an item when this differs from the recommended or marked price. Format 9(10)V9(4)
Registered Text Code.201: Gross Profit Percentage Percentage difference between the in-store price and the net cost from the supplier. Format 9(3)V9(3)
Registered Text Code.202: Best Before End Date (Supplementary Product Data) Format 9(6) YYMMDD
Registered Text Code.206: Invoice Line Reference To hold a consumer's or dealer's reference at line level on an invoice Format X(35) variable length
Registered Text Code.207: Insured's Name The name of the insured party (which may be different to the driver of the vehicle)
Registered Text Code.208: Third Party's Name The name of any third party involved with the incident
Registered Text Code.209: Invoice for Period From Format YYMMDD
Registered Text Code.210: Invoice for Period To Format YYMMDD
Registered Text Code.211: Corporate Indicator Indicates whether an order has been placed by a corporate customer or an individual Format X(40)
Registered Text Code.212: Carrier Identity Identifies the carrier of the products ordered by name and/or number Format X(40)
Registered Text Code.213: Due Date for Pickup To inform the supplier and the carrier of the date by which pickup should have occurred Format 9(6) YYMMDD
Registered Text Code.214: >Please quote this message on all documents Used to include a line of text which must be printed by the recipient on any subsequent documentation sent back to the originator of the EDI message. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code.217: Delivery Cycle The time of day in which the depot will deliver the stock to the stores.  Suggested values AM or PM Format X(10)
Registered Text Code.218: Number of Pallets The total number of pallets on the vehicle Format 9(15)
Registered Text Code.220: Special Delivery Instructions To indicate whether pre-booking is required Format X(40)
Registered Text Code.221: Delivery Note Number To reference the relevant Delivery Note Format X(17)
Registered Text Code.222: Customer's Own Article Number Where a delivery/uplift is a relationship between a carrier and a retailer/manufacturer, this element pertains to the article ordered from the retailer/manufacturer by the end customer.
Registered Text Code.224: Usual Delivery Point Used to indicate whether a product is delivered by the supplier into the store or into the central warehouse. Suggested values 'S' store delivery, 'W' warehouse delivery. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code.225: Energy Supply Zero Rated Reason for zero rate given in format X(40) Suggested values `P' prepaid, `L' low consumption
Registered Text Code.226: Packaging Reference To identify the reference number of the parcel or package into which the line item should be packed. Format X(17).
Registered Text Code.227: Destination Code Indicates that a delivery line is intended for a specific final destination, so cannot be allocated to another destination by the depot. Format X(3)
Registered Text Code.228: Temperature Regime Indicates the temperature, or temperature range, at which the goods must be stored and handled.  Suggested temperature range codes are as follows: C - Cold Chain (between 0 and 10 C) A - Ambient Format X(3)
Registered Text Code.229: Delivery Line Number Additional reference for a line on a Delivery Notification.  Used to track goods sent via transshipment locations.  The lines may not be split at the consolidation depot. Format 9(3)
Registered Text Code.230: Additional Order Specifications Additional specific indication of the type of order, the reason for the order, or special service requirements, where these aspects are not covered by industry code lists. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code.231: Special processing Instruction Defines a process to be applied to a product before despatch.  Used in the book trade to cover processing by library suppliers, when industry code lists do not exist.
Registered Text Code.232: Customer Delivery Reference The booking reference for the customer Format X(17)
Registered Text Code.235: Substitution Items DUN-14 Code Used for traded units identified by a DUN-14 Code Format 9(14)
Registered Text Code.236: Production Week Number Indicates the calendar week that the product will be produced. Format 9(3)
Registered Text Code.237: Destination Country Use the ISO country code list 3166 Format X(3)
Registered Text Code.238: Deal Number Unique identifier of a deal Format X(17)
Registered Text Code.239: Project Number Unique identifier of a promotional project Format X(17)
Registered Text Code.240: Incentive Value Value of the incentive as an amount or a percentage (used with RTEX 241) Format 9(10)V9(4)
Registered Text Code.241: Incentive Type Description of type of incentive eg. free gift, buy 10 get 1 free, 10% extra etc. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code.242: Agreed Capacity (Electricity Supply) Maximum supply capacity agreed between Host REC and customer within the customer connection agreement. Format 9(6)
Registered Text Code.243: KW Monthly Maximum (Electricity Supply) Maximum KW demand recorded in a monthly period.  Usually required during the Host REC's 'peak' period (typically November to February). Format 9(6)
Registered Text Code.244: KVA Monthly Maximum (Electricity Supply) Maximum KVA demand recorded within the Host REC's 'peak' period (typically November to February) Format 9(6)
Registered Text Code.245: Supply Monthly Maximum (Electricity Supply) Maximum demand within the period covered by the DUoS bill Format 9(6)
Registered Text Code.246: Agreed Minimum Chargeable Capacity (Electricity Supply) Minimum supply capacity (for availability charge), agreed between Host REC and customer within the customer connection agreement. Format 9(6)
Registered Text Code.247: Months To Run of Minimum Chargeable Capacity Agreement Format 9(2)
Registered Text Code.248: Portion Of Month (in 30ths) Covered By This Bill Format 9(2)
Registered Text Code.249: Special Labelling Requirement To advise suppliers of special labels or tickets which must be affixed to the goods being supplied Format X(40)
Registered Text Code.250: Returnable Container Used to identify the type of returnable container e.g. tray in which the goods are delivered, stored or transported Format X(40)
Registered Text Code.251: Third Party Delivery Reference Original delivery reference for goods movements between a supplier and a third party such as a haulier or consolidator Format X(17)
Registered Text Code.252: Third Party Order Reference Original order reference for goods supplied via a haulier or consolidator Format X(17)
Registered Text Code.253: Order Time Time order generated by ordering system.  Used to eliminate duplicate orders. Format 9(6) HHMMSS
Registered Text Code.254: Manufacturer's Recommended Selling Price in quoted currency Format 9(10)V9(4) (formerly code 074)
Registered Text Code.255: Net Book Price in quoted currency Format 9(10)V9(4) (formerly code 075)
Registered Text Code.256: Third Party Supplier's EAN Location Number Identification of the original supplier of goods delivered by a third party haulier or consolidator.
Registered Text Code.257: Marketing Division Name Identification of the division responsible for a product. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code.258: Original Invoice Date Date of original invoice (requested for use in Utility Bill File, when the bill is being used as a Credit Note) Format 9(6) YYMMDD
Registered Text Code.259: Job Time The time at which the job was completed (24Hr) Format 9(4) HHMM
Registered Text Code.260: Job Location The location at which the job was performed in free text Format X(40)
Registered Text Code.261: Glass Repair Potential for glass to be repaired Format X(40)
Registered Text Code.262: Damage Zone The zone in which the damage has occurred Format X
Registered Text Code.263: Size Code The size of the damage area in coded format Format X
Registered Text Code.264: Policy Code Policy qualifications in coded format Format X(40)
Registered Text Code.266: Original Glass The type of glass originally fitted Format X(40)
Registered Text Code.267: Glass Condition Condition of glass at time of job Format X(40)
Registered Text Code.268: Unique copy ID Library acquisitions number which identifies a single copy of a book or publication Format 9(15)
Registered Text Code.269: Shelf Mark (or spine label) Applied on the spine label of a book or publication to specify recommended shelf location (libraries) Format X(40)
Registered Text Code.270: Shelving Sequence Specifies shelf sequence of a book or publication (libraries) Format X(40)
Registered Text Code.271: Shelf Filing suffix Specifies shelving location within a classification of a book or publication (libraries) Format X(40)
Registered Text Code.272: Feature Heading An extension applied to the classification of an individual copy of a book or publication to further detail content or shelving (libraries) Format X(40)
Registered Text Code.273: Size Code Specifies a size group or range for a specific application (eg A4 for  paper or Quarto for books) Format X(40)
Registered Text Code.274: Branch Allocation Code Identifies the location to which an item has been allocated Format X(40)
Registered Text Code.275: Replacement Value Used when charging for loss or damage Format 9(10)V9(2)
Registered Text Code.276: Availability status of original product, when this has been substituted by an alternative item.
Registered Text Code.277: Time Period To identify a period of time or time band, as previously defined with a trading partner.  Suggested values >1', >2', >3' etc. Format X(3)
Registered Text Code.278: Percentage of Normal Billing Period Covered By This Bill Format 9(4) with no decimal places. Note: this can be calculated from the bill frequency code (BCD BIFR) and the supply period dates (BCD
Registered Text Code.279: Provisional invoice (not valid for tax purposes) unique reference to allow consolidation to a consolidated tax invoice.  A periodic consolidated tax invoice must follow (either EDI or paper document). Format X(40)
Registered Text Code.280: Surcharge Type Describes the type of surcharges for which an amount is shown in TLR SURT Suggested values are: C - Carriage Charge (VATable); I - Insurance. Format X (3)
Registered Text Code.282: Returnable asset identification (allocated by the owner of the asset).  Corresponds to EAN data following the application identifier of  8003.  See the ANA's Article Numbering and Symbol Marking Operating Manual for further details. Format X(30)
Registered Text Code.283: Serial asset identification (allocated by the owner of the asset).  Corresponds to EAN data following the application identifier of  8004.  See the ANA's Article Numbering and Symbol Marking Operating Manual for further details. Format X(30)
Registered Text Code.284: Serial number of a product allocated by the manufacturer. Corresponds to EAN data following the application identifier of 21.  Must be used in conjunction with an applicatoin identifyer of (01).  See the ANA's Article Numbering and Symbol Marking Operating Manual for further details. Format X(20)
Registered Text Code.285: When returning items, expected/estimated value of credit.  If the figure can not be calculated automatically, quoted by customer to indicate an expected value. Format 9(10)V9(4)
Registered Text Code.286: Time Order Received Used to hold the time this order was received (24 hour).
Registered Text Code.287: Time Pick Note Issued Used to hold the time the pick note was issued for this order (24 hour). Format 9(4) HHMM
Registered Text Code.288: Supplier=s Quotation Line Reference Corresponds to an unique reference, enabling the quotation line to be cited in a customer=s order line or in a subsequent order-related message. Format X(35)
Registered Text Code.289: Account Holder Name Code to indicate that the next piece of data is the account holder=s name in text. Format X(30)
Registered Text Code.290: Last Payment Date Code to indicate that the next piece of data is the date the last payment was received. Format 9(6) YYMMDD
Registered Text Code.291: Outstanding - Six Month OCC Code to indicate that the next piece of data is a value which represents this. Format 9(8)V9(2)
Registered Text Code.292: Unbilled - Six Month OCC Code to indicate that the next piece of data is a value which represents this. Format 9(8)V9(2)
Registered Text Code.293: Handset Cost via HSI Code to indicate that the next piece of data is a value which represents this. Format 9(8)V9(2)
Registered Text Code.294: Disclosed Cost Price Used in rebate schemes, or when the price notified to an outlet or other location (e.g. on a printed delivery note) differs from the actual price. Format 9(10)V9(4)
Registered Text Code.295: Catalogue or Price List Reference A reference to a supplier=s catalogue or price list, from which the product information used in an order was derived. Format X(35)
Registered Text Code.296: VAT Breakdown of a mixed rate VAT item reference Used to give advance information to a retailer or wholesaler on the exact VAT breakdown of a mixed-rate item.  For products carrying mixed-rate VAT, this specifies the part of the recommended retail price, excluding VAT, which carries VAT at a rate specified in an associated DNAC field detailed using Code List 12 values. Format  9(10)V9(4)
Registered Text Code.297: Delivery Days Indicator To indicate that the next piece of data shows the possible delivery days. The string begins on Monday and the last character represents Sunday.  A Y signifies possible, a N signifies not possible. Format X(7) YNYYNNY
Registered Text Code.298: Telephone Sale/Order Call Time To indicate the time of the telephone call. Format 9(4) HHMM
Registered Text Code.299: Telephone Sale/Order Call Days Indicator To indicate that the next piece of data shows the call days . The string begins on Monday and the last character represents Sunday.  A Y signifies the day a call was made/received.  The rest of the string is filled with character N. Format X(7)NYNNYNN300 Total Number of Pages Used to give the total number of pages in a book or in a set of books sold as a single item. Format 9(6) Variable Length
Registered Text Code.301: Market Restrictions Used to indicate, in free form or in a format agreed between trading partners, geographical restrictions on the sale of a product (e.g. where a publisher or distributor has rights only for a designated set of territories). Format X(40) Variable Length
Registered Text Code.302: Low Stock Indicator Used to carry a code indicating that the supplier currently has low stocks of a product line item. Format X(1)
Registered Text Code.303: Delivery Time Window To indicate the possible delivery time slots, giving a choice of two ranges of time. Format 9(16) - HHMMHHMMHHMMHHMM
Registered Text Code.304: SSCC Unique reference to indicate the serial shipping container code for the pallet or container. Format 9(18)
Registered Text Code.305: Barrel Conversion Factor Used to convert the sales of traded units to their equivalent barrel. Format 9(3)V9(9)
Registered Text Code.306: Alcohol By Volume (ABV) Percentage To define the percentage of alcohol in a product. Format 9(3)V9(3)
Registered Text Code.307: Ullage Code To identify the type of beer being returned as unsaleable. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code.308: Illustrations Note Free text statement of the number and/or type of illustrations in a book or other publication. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code.309: Power Factor The ratio of power dissipated to the total power. Format 9(4)V(3)
Registered Text Code.310: Load Factor The duration in a 24 hour cycle that the power is used, i.e. 12 hours would be 50%. Format 9(4)V(3)
Registered Text Code.311: Night Unit Percentage The percentage of night units used in proportion to the total usage. Format 9(4)V(3)
Registered Text Code.312: (BEN) Co-publisher The name of the co-publisher of a book or other publication which is jointly published by two or more organisations. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code.313: (BEN) Estimated time to manufacture For a book or other publication which is "manufactured on demand", the estimated number of calendar days from receipt of an order to its despatch to the customer. Format 9(2)V

Reason for Credit Code.44: Defective Product (in manufacture rendering product unfit for sale and/or use)
Reason for Credit Code.45: Wrong or defective service (defect in service, customisation, modification of a product)

VAT Rate Category Code.V: Standard rated free goods, VAT not charged
VAT Rate Category Code.W: Intracompany transfer - Companies must have same VAT number

VAT Type of Supply Code.H: Sale or Return, or similar terms

Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).047: Paragraph within Conditions of Sale or Purchase to which particular attention is drawn for this Order
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).048: Rate of Duty Pay Back applicable for this sale ordered item
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).058: Stock Point (physical segregation of stock where location is not necessarily holder's warehouse)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).059: Collecting Depot (where Depot receiving refused goods is different to that from which they were delivered)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).074: Manufacturer's Recommended Selling Price in quoted currency, shown with 2 decimal places implicit
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).075: Net Book Price in quoted currency, shown with 2 decimal places implicit
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).076: Consignee's Order Number where a delivery/uplift is a relationship between a Carrier and a Retailer/Manufacturer, this element pertains to the order number supplied to the Retailer/Manufacturer by the end Customer
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).077: Goods Exchange Reference when the uplift of faulty goods is done at the same time as the delivery of the replacements, the delivery and uplift are cross-referred to each other using the Goods Exchange Reference
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).078: Mail Order Publication Reference Reference to a particular publication eg. Autumn/Winter as opposed to Spring/Summer catalogue
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).086: Order Length Required These are order specific tolerances that British Steel customers will be required to specify when ordering standard sizes or lengths
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).087: Viewdata Stock Allocation Quantity Quantity of stock allocated to order by Philips "MOVIES" viewdata system
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).088: Diary Class For use with the diary of negotiated delivery dates
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).097: Settlement Terms This is the discount given when a customer pays within a set number of days.  It consists of a percentage and a number of days in three consecutive blocks of 8 digits.  Each block has 3 digit percentage integers, 2 decimal places and 3 digits for the number of days eg. 2.5% within 10 days = 00250010
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).100: Viewdata Stock Location Code - Format X(6)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).101: Stock/Non Stock Order Indicator Suggested values: 1 = stock replenishment order;  2 = non-stock order to meet a specific requirement
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).102: Quality Assurance Order subject to QA procedures of the purchaser
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).103: Quality Assurance Purchaser's representative's release note to accompany the goods
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).104: Quality Assurance Test certificates to be provided
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).105: Quality Assurance Item(s) for use above 7 Bar
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).107: Name of Person to Whom Goods are to be Delivered
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).108: Retail Selling Price for a Product in an Order Line; field size 9(5), price in pence
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).109: Customer's Merchandise Department Department within the ordering company who are responsible for this product line.  The customer will advise the location code to be used
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).110: Goods Received Note Identity Number Format X(9)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).111: Advice Note Number Format X(20) Used when number is larger than standard
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).112: Order Number for Self Billed Invoicing Format X(25) which is greater than the ORNO field
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).113: Quantity Supplied - format 9(6)V9(5), used with QTYI fields
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).114: Price per Unit - format 9(9)V9(2), used with AUCT
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).115: Original Unit Price - format 9(9)V9(2), used for retrospective price adjustments
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).116: Line Level Goods Value - format 9(9)V9(2), used with LEXC
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).117: Total Goods Value - format 9(11)V(2), used with LVLA
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).120: Date of Incident - the date on which the cause of the supply happened - format YYMMDD
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).121: Date of Insurance Renewal - format YYMMDD
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).122: Customer Registered for VAT Indicator - Value will be Y or N
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).123: Odometer Reading - records the mileage at the time of supply - format 9(8)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).125: Warranty Number - this will record the warranty certificate number.  Format X(30)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).126: Reason Code - format X(3).  This is the reason for doing the job on the vehicle, eg. radio replaced due to theft etc.
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).127: Action Code - format X(3).  This is the action taken eg. supply and fit, supply only, fit only, etc.
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).128: Country of Origin - use the 2 alpha ISO country codes found in the Trade Data Elements Directory (TDED) in code list 3207 (EDIFACT) : ISO Code List 3166
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).129: Data Source and Version Number Text
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).130: Contra Account, Short name - text The name of the company to whom the pallet is interchanged
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).133: Master Case Order quantity - this is the order line quantity expressed as a number of master shipping cases
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).134: TI Multiple - format 9(6).  This indicates the number of shipping cases per tier of a pallet for an order line/delivery note
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).135: HI Multiple - format 9(6).  This indicates the number of layers/tiers on the pallet
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).136: ANA Number Representing the Factor Involved in the Assigned Invoice - format 9(13)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).137: Part Type - this enables the supplier to indicate the type of part supplied for onward billing
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).138: Contact Name at the Delivery Address - format maximum size X(35)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).139: Style - format X(15).  Code describing the style of the article ordered, where the product code is not sufficient
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).140: Department Code - format X(4).  Company's own department code
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).141: Colour Description of the Product - format X(35)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).144: House of Fraser Season Code - format X(1)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).145: Customer's Telephone Number - format X(25) *INCREASED FROM 9(10)*
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).146: Documentation Requirements - This is specific to B&Q as it is a concatenated set of data, the detail of which is separated by a comma as a field separator.  Data will be sent in the following order: No. of Invoice Copies V 9(2) No. of Packing List Copies V 9(2) No. of GSP Form A V 9(2) No. of Certificates of Origin V 9(2) No. of Specification Sheets V 9(2) No. of Inspection Certificates V 9(2) No. of Clean 'Shipped on Board' B/L V 9(2) No. of CMR V 9(2) No. of Proof of Delivery Documents V 9(2) No. of Days Before ETA Documents Must Arrive V 9(2) If there is no data, the field will have a '0' between the commas
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).147: Letter of Credit Details - This is a concatenation of the: Letter of Credit No. - format V X(11) Letter of Credit Opened Date - format F 9(6) Letter of Credit Expiry Date - format F 9(6)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).148: Shipment Details - This is a concatenation of the: Shipment Estimated Date of Departure - format F 9(6) Shipment Estimated Date of Arrival - format F 9(6)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).149: Schedule for the delivery of an order line.  A concatenated field used to specify, as a string of data, the required date 9(6), and the required quantity. The required quantity is split into three sub-elements; the number of traded units 9(15), the total measure 9(10)V9(3) and the measure indicator X(6). The quantity fields become fixed length fields as there are no separator characters.
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).150: Supplying Branch Telephone Number The telephone number of the supplier's retail outlet, up to 9(11) (UK).
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).151: Vehicle Description: Text description of the vehicle. X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).152: Client's reference for the vehicle X(40).
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).154: Type of invoice indicator: Used by Fleetnet to indicate the type of service invoiced as each has separate processing rules. Codes for this agreed and maintained by the Fleetnet community.
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).155: *Coal or Coke Invoice indicator: format 9(1). Has the following values 1 = Coal, or 2 = Coke.* Haulier Code: format X(3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).156: Invoice or Adjustment Type: format 9(1) British Coal code list. Values are: 1 = Current Month Invoice 2 = Previous Month Supplementary Invoice Debit 3 = Previous Month Supplementary Invoice Credit 4 = Debit or Credit Adjustment 5 = Weekly Invoice 6 = Weekly Supplementary Invoice Debit 7 = Weekly Supplementary Invoice Credit 8 = Weekly Interim Invoice
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).157: Invoice Location Code: Format V X(13) British Coal location to which queries should be addressed
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).158: Consignee Name: Format X (40), Name of consignee. This may not be the same as the destination name
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).159: Destination Name: Format X (40), Name of destination
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).160: Method of Transport: Format X (2), British Coal codes RD = Road, RL = Rail, CN = Canal, OM = Other Methods
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).161: Customer code for consignee; Format X (14); Code allocated by customer
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).162: Method of Loading: Format X (3); British Coal code
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).163: BACS Reference: Format X (15): Reference allocated by BACS to a payment. Used in conjunction with Remittance Advices
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).174: Payment Method, Use bank standard codes
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).175: Payment Date, 9(6) YYMMDD. Date payment was transferred, if electronic, or will be raised if a cheque
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).176: Payment Reference, X (17), the number of the cheque or payment order
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).178: Months in service, 9(2), The number of months since the vehicle was taken onto a leasing scheme
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).179: Charge Type, Code given to define the type of charge, eg Contract Hire, Lease Rental etc.
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).180: Charge Period. Period to which a charge relates

Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).184: Serial Shipping Container Code, Format: 9(18) To identify individual pallets delivered
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).185: Number of Cases, Format: 9(5) To show number of cases on an individual pallet, which may differ from the standard number given in the original order

Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).189: Pressurised Systems Legislation: to indicate items for use below 2 bar

Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).191: Contractor's Name The name of the contractor who has completed the work on a vehicle which is then being invoiced to a contract hire company and then re-invoiced to the operating company.
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).192: Contractor's Town Town where the work was carried out
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).193: Voucher Date Date on which the Fleetcard Voucher was completed. Format: 9(6) YYMMDD
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).194: Transaction Reference Reference relating to the original work carried out
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).195: Amended line code Generic code to identify the field(s) which have been amended, ie. change in quantity or price, on an Order or Complex Order amendment message. To aid automatic processing of messages received. The Registered Text field following the code to be used to detail the amendment in plain text for manual processing
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).196: Total Ordered Lines Product lines called off on Picking List Format: 9(10)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).197: Total Ordered Quantity Quantity called off on Picking List Format: 9(15)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).198: Total Received Lines Product lines booked in at warehouse.  Format: 9(10)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).199: Total Received Quantity - Quantity booked in at warehouse Format: 9(15)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).200: In-store price Selling price of an item when this differs from the recommended or marked price. Format 9(10)V9(4)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).201: Gross Profit Percentage Percentage difference between the in-store price and the net cost from the supplier. Format 9(3)V9(3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).202: Best Before End Date (Supplementary Product Data) Format 9(6) YYMMDD
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).206: Invoice Line Reference To hold a consumer's or dealer's reference at line level on an invoice Format X(35) variable length
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).207: Insured's Name The name of the insured party (which may be different to the driver of the vehicle)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).208: Third Party's Name The name of any third party involved with the incident
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).209: Invoice for Period From Format YYMMDD
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).210: Invoice for Period To Format YYMMDD
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).211: Corporate Indicator Indicates whether an order has been placed by a corporate customer or an individual Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).212: Carrier Identity Identifies the carrier of the products ordered by name and/or number Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).213: Due Date for Pickup To inform the supplier and the carrier of the date by which pickup should have occurred Format 9(6) YYMMDD
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).214: >Please quote this message on all documents Used to include a line of text which must be printed by the recipient on any subsequent documentation sent back to the originator of the EDI message. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).217: Delivery Cycle The time of day in which the depot will deliver the stock to the stores.  Suggested values AM or PM Format X(10)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).218: Number of Pallets The total number of pallets on the vehicle Format 9(15)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).220: Special Delivery Instructions To indicate whether pre-booking is required Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).221: Delivery Note Number To reference the relevant Delivery Note Format X(17)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).222: Customer's Own Article Number Where a delivery/uplift is a relationship between a carrier and a retailer/manufacturer, this element pertains to the article ordered from the retailer/manufacturer by the end customer.
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).224: Usual Delivery Point Used to indicate whether a product is delivered by the supplier into the store or into the central warehouse. Suggested values 'S' store delivery, 'W' warehouse delivery. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).225: Energy Supply Zero Rated Reason for zero rate given in format X(40) Suggested values `P' prepaid, `L' low consumption
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).226: Packaging Reference To identify the reference number of the parcel or package into which the line item should be packed. Format X(17).
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).227: Destination Code Indicates that a delivery line is intended for a specific final destination, so cannot be allocated to another destination by the depot. Format X(3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).228: Temperature Regime Indicates the temperature, or temperature range, at which the goods must be stored and handled.  Suggested temperature range codes are as follows: C - Cold Chain (between 0 and 10 C) A - Ambient Format X(3)

Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).230: Additional Order Specifications Additional specific indication of the type of order, the reason for the order, or special service requirements, where these aspects are not covered by industry code lists. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).231: Special processing Instruction Defines a process to be applied to a product before despatch.  Used in the book trade to cover processing by library suppliers, when industry code lists do not exist.
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).232: Customer Delivery Reference The booking reference for the customer Format X(17)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).235: Substitution Items DUN-14 Code Used for traded units identified by a DUN-14 Code Format 9(14)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).236: Production Week Number Indicates the calendar week that the product will be produced. Format 9(3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).237: Destination Country Use the ISO country code list 3166 Format X(3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).238: Deal Number Unique identifier of a deal Format X(17)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).239: Project Number Unique identifier of a promotional project Format X(17)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).240: Incentive Value Value of the incentive as an amount or a percentage (used with RTEX 241) Format 9(10)V9(4)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).241: Incentive Type Description of type of incentive eg. free gift, buy 10 get 1 free, 10% extra etc. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).242: Agreed Capacity (Electricity Supply) Maximum supply capacity agreed between Host REC and customer within the customer connection agreement. Format 9(6)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).243: KW Monthly Maximum (Electricity Supply) Maximum KW demand recorded in a monthly period.  Usually required during the Host REC's 'peak' period (typically November to February). Format 9(6)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).244: KVA Monthly Maximum (Electricity Supply) Maximum KVA demand recorded within the Host REC's 'peak' period (typically November to February) Format 9(6)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).245: Supply Monthly Maximum (Electricity Supply) Maximum demand within the period covered by the DUoS bill Format 9(6)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).246: Agreed Minimum Chargeable Capacity (Electricity Supply) Minimum supply capacity (for availability charge), agreed between Host REC and customer within the customer connection agreement. Format 9(6)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).247: Months To Run of Minimum Chargeable Capacity Agreement Format 9(2)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).248: Portion Of Month (in 30ths) Covered By This Bill Format 9(2)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).249: Special Labelling Requirement To advise suppliers of special labels or tickets which must be affixed to the goods being supplied Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).250: Returnable Container Used to identify the type of returnable container e.g. tray in which the goods are delivered, stored or transported Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).251: Third Party Delivery Reference Original delivery reference for goods movements between a supplier and a third party such as a haulier or consolidator Format X(17)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).252: Third Party Order Reference Original order reference for goods supplied via a haulier or consolidator Format X(17)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).253: Order Time Time order generated by ordering system.  Used to eliminate duplicate orders. Format 9(6) HHMMSS
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).254: Manufacturer's Recommended Selling Price in quoted currency Format 9(10)V9(4) (formerly code 074)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).255: Net Book Price in quoted currency Format 9(10)V9(4) (formerly code 075)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).256: Third Party Supplier's EAN Location Number Identification of the original supplier of goods delivered by a third party haulier or consolidator.
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).257: Marketing Division Name Identification of the division responsible for a product. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).258: Original Invoice Date Date of original invoice (requested for use in Utility Bill File, when the bill is being used as a Credit Note) Format 9(6) YYMMDD
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).259: Job Time The time at which the job was completed (24Hr) Format 9(4) HHMM
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).260: Job Location The location at which the job was performed in free text Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).261: Glass Repair Potential for glass to be repaired Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).262: Damage Zone The zone in which the damage has occurred Format X
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).263: Size Code The size of the damage area in coded format Format X
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).264: Policy Code Policy qualifications in coded format Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).266: Original Glass The type of glass originally fitted Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).267: Glass Condition Condition of glass at time of job Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).268: Unique copy ID Library acquisitions number which identifies a single copy of a book or publication Format 9(15)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).269: Shelf Mark (or spine label) Applied on the spine label of a book or publication to specify recommended shelf location (libraries) Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).270: Shelving Sequence Specifies shelf sequence of a book or publication (libraries) Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).271: Shelf Filing suffix Specifies shelving location within a classification of a book or publication (libraries) Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).272: Feature Heading An extension applied to the classification of an individual copy of a book or publication to further detail content or shelving (libraries) Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).273: Size Code Specifies a size group or range for a specific application (eg A4 for  paper or Quarto for books) Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).274: Branch Allocation Code Identifies the location to which an item has been allocated Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).275: Replacement Value Used when charging for loss or damage Format 9(10)V9(2)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).276: Availability status of original product, when this has been substituted by an alternative item.
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).277: Time Period To identify a period of time or time band, as previously defined with a trading partner.  Suggested values >1', >2', >3' etc. Format X(3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).278: Percentage of Normal Billing Period Covered By This Bill Format 9(4) with no decimal places. Note: this can be calculated from the bill frequency code (BCD BIFR) and the supply period dates (BCD
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).279: Provisional invoice (not valid for tax purposes) unique reference to allow consolidation to a consolidated tax invoice.  A periodic consolidated tax invoice must follow (either EDI or paper document). Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).280: Surcharge Type Describes the type of surcharges for which an amount is shown in TLR SURT Suggested values are: C - Carriage Charge (VATable); I - Insurance. Format X (3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).282: Returnable asset identification (allocated by the owner of the asset).  Corresponds to EAN data following the application identifier of  8003.  See the ANA's Article Numbering and Symbol Marking Operating Manual for further details. Format X(30)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).283: Serial asset identification (allocated by the owner of the asset).  Corresponds to EAN data following the application identifier of  8004.  See the ANA's Article Numbering and Symbol Marking Operating Manual for further details. Format X(30)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).284: Serial number of a product allocated by the manufacturer. Corresponds to EAN data following the application identifier of 21.  Must be used in conjunction with an applicatoin identifyer of (01).  See the ANA's Article Numbering and Symbol Marking Operating Manual for further details. Format X(20)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).285: When returning items, expected/estimated value of credit.  If the figure can not be calculated automatically, quoted by customer to indicate an expected value. Format 9(10)V9(4)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).286: Time Order Received Used to hold the time this order was received (24 hour).
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).287: Time Pick Note Issued Used to hold the time the pick note was issued for this order (24 hour). Format 9(4) HHMM
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).288: Supplier=s Quotation Line Reference Corresponds to an unique reference, enabling the quotation line to be cited in a customer=s order line or in a subsequent order-related message. Format X(35)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).289: Account Holder Name Code to indicate that the next piece of data is the account holder=s name in text. Format X(30)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).290: Last Payment Date Code to indicate that the next piece of data is the date the last payment was received. Format 9(6) YYMMDD
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).291: Outstanding - Six Month OCC Code to indicate that the next piece of data is a value which represents this. Format 9(8)V9(2)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).292: Unbilled - Six Month OCC Code to indicate that the next piece of data is a value which represents this. Format 9(8)V9(2)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).293: Handset Cost via HSI Code to indicate that the next piece of data is a value which represents this. Format 9(8)V9(2)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).294: Disclosed Cost Price Used in rebate schemes, or when the price notified to an outlet or other location (e.g. on a printed delivery note) differs from the actual price. Format 9(10)V9(4)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).295: Catalogue or Price List Reference A reference to a supplier=s catalogue or price list, from which the product information used in an order was derived. Format X(35)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).296: VAT Breakdown of a mixed rate VAT item reference Used to give advance information to a retailer or wholesaler on the exact VAT breakdown of a mixed-rate item.  For products carrying mixed-rate VAT, this specifies the part of the recommended retail price, excluding VAT, which carries VAT at a rate specified in an associated DNAC field detailed using Code List 12 values. Format  9(10)V9(4)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).297: Delivery Days Indicator To indicate that the next piece of data shows the possible delivery days. The string begins on Monday and the last character represents Sunday.  A Y signifies possible, a N signifies not possible. Format X(7) YNYYNNY
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).298: Telephone Sale/Order Call Time To indicate the time of the telephone call. Format 9(4) HHMM
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).299: Telephone Sale/Order Call Days Indicator To indicate that the next piece of data shows the call days . The string begins on Monday and the last character represents Sunday.  A Y signifies the day a call was made/received.  The rest of the string is filled with character N. Format X(7)NYNNYNN300 Total Number of Pages Used to give the total number of pages in a book or in a set of books sold as a single item. Format 9(6) Variable Length
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).301: Market Restrictions Used to indicate, in free form or in a format agreed between trading partners, geographical restrictions on the sale of a product (e.g. where a publisher or distributor has rights only for a designated set of territories). Format X(40) Variable Length
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).302: Low Stock Indicator Used to carry a code indicating that the supplier currently has low stocks of a product line item. Format X(1)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).303: Delivery Time Window To indicate the possible delivery time slots, giving a choice of two ranges of time. Format 9(16) - HHMMHHMMHHMMHHMM
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).304: SSCC Unique reference to indicate the serial shipping container code for the pallet or container. Format 9(18)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).305: Barrel Conversion Factor Used to convert the sales of traded units to their equivalent barrel. Format 9(3)V9(9)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).306: Alcohol By Volume (ABV) Percentage To define the percentage of alcohol in a product. Format 9(3)V9(3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).307: Ullage Code To identify the type of beer being returned as unsaleable. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).308: Illustrations Note Free text statement of the number and/or type of illustrations in a book or other publication. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).309: Power Factor The ratio of power dissipated to the total power. Format 9(4)V(3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).310: Load Factor The duration in a 24 hour cycle that the power is used, i.e. 12 hours would be 50%. Format 9(4)V(3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).311: Night Unit Percentage The percentage of night units used in proportion to the total usage. Format 9(4)V(3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).312: (BEN) Co-publisher The name of the co-publisher of a book or other publication which is jointly published by two or more organisations. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-3).313: (BEN) Estimated time to manufacture For a book or other publication which is "manufactured on demand", the estimated number of calendar days from receipt of an order to its despatch to the customer. Format 9(2)V

Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).088: Diary Class For use with the diary of negotiated delivery dates
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).097: Settlement Terms This is the discount given when a customer pays within a set number of days.  It consists of a percentage and a number of days in three consecutive blocks of 8 digits.  Each block has 3 digit percentage integers, 2 decimal places and 3 digits for the number of days eg. 2.5% within 10 days = 00250010
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).100: Viewdata Stock Location Code - Format X(6)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).101: Stock/Non Stock Order Indicator Suggested values: 1 = stock replenishment order;  2 = non-stock order to meet a specific requirement

Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).105: Quality Assurance Item(s) for use above 7 Bar

Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).111: Advice Note Number Format X(20) Used when number is larger than standard

To aid automatic processing of messages received. The Registered Text field following the code to be used to detail the amendment in plain text for manual processing
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).196: Total Ordered Lines Product lines called off on Picking List Format: 9(10)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).197: Total Ordered Quantity Quantity called off on Picking List Format: 9(15)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).198: Total Received Lines Product lines booked in at warehouse.  Format: 9(10)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).199: Total Received Quantity - Quantity booked in at warehouse Format: 9(15)

Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).202: Best Before End Date (Supplementary Product Data) Format 9(6) YYMMDD

Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).207: Insured's Name The name of the insured party (which may be different to the driver of the vehicle)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).208: Third Party's Name The name of any third party involved with the incident
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).209: Invoice for Period From Format YYMMDD
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).210: Invoice for Period To Format YYMMDD
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).211: Corporate Indicator Indicates whether an order has been placed by a corporate customer or an individual Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).212: Carrier Identity Identifies the carrier of the products ordered by name and/or number Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).213: Due Date for Pickup To inform the supplier and the carrier of the date by which pickup should have occurred Format 9(6) YYMMDD
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).214: >Please quote this message on all documents Used to include a line of text which must be printed by the recipient on any subsequent documentation sent back to the originator of the EDI message. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).217: Delivery Cycle The time of day in which the depot will deliver the stock to the stores.  Suggested values AM or PM Format X(10)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).218: Number of Pallets The total number of pallets on the vehicle Format 9(15)

Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).224: Usual Delivery Point Used to indicate whether a product is delivered by the supplier into the store or into the central warehouse. Suggested values 'S' store delivery, 'W' warehouse delivery. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).225: Energy Supply Zero Rated Reason for zero rate given in format X(40) Suggested values `P' prepaid, `L' low consumption
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).226: Packaging Reference To identify the reference number of the parcel or package into which the line item should be packed. Format X(17).

Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).230: Additional Order Specifications Additional specific indication of the type of order, the reason for the order, or special service requirements, where these aspects are not covered by industry code lists. Format X(40)

Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).235: Substitution Items DUN-14 Code Used for traded units identified by a DUN-14 Code Format 9(14)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).236: Production Week Number Indicates the calendar week that the product will be produced. Format 9(3)

Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).238: Deal Number Unique identifier of a deal Format X(17)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).239: Project Number Unique identifier of a promotional project Format X(17)
