Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).242: Agreed Capacity (Electricity Supply) Maximum supply capacity agreed between Host REC and customer within the customer connection agreement. Format 9(6)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).243: KW Monthly Maximum (Electricity Supply) Maximum KW demand recorded in a monthly period.  Usually required during the Host REC's 'peak' period (typically November to February). Format 9(6)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).244: KVA Monthly Maximum (Electricity Supply) Maximum KVA demand recorded within the Host REC's 'peak' period (typically November to February) Format 9(6)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).245: Supply Monthly Maximum (Electricity Supply) Maximum demand within the period covered by the DUoS bill Format 9(6)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).246: Agreed Minimum Chargeable Capacity (Electricity Supply) Minimum supply capacity (for availability charge), agreed between Host REC and customer within the customer connection agreement. Format 9(6)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).247: Months To Run of Minimum Chargeable Capacity Agreement Format 9(2)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).248: Portion Of Month (in 30ths) Covered By This Bill Format 9(2)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).249: Special Labelling Requirement To advise suppliers of special labels or tickets which must be affixed to the goods being supplied Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).250: Returnable Container Used to identify the type of returnable container e.g. tray in which the goods are delivered, stored or transported Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).251: Third Party Delivery Reference Original delivery reference for goods movements between a supplier and a third party such as a haulier or consolidator Format X(17)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).252: Third Party Order Reference Original order reference for goods supplied via a haulier or consolidator Format X(17)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).253: Order Time Time order generated by ordering system.  Used to eliminate duplicate orders. Format 9(6) HHMMSS
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).254: Manufacturer's Recommended Selling Price in quoted currency Format 9(10)V9(4) (formerly code 074)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).255: Net Book Price in quoted currency Format 9(10)V9(4) (formerly code 075)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).256: Third Party Supplier's EAN Location Number Identification of the original supplier of goods delivered by a third party haulier or consolidator.
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).257: Marketing Division Name Identification of the division responsible for a product. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).258: Original Invoice Date Date of original invoice (requested for use in Utility Bill File, when the bill is being used as a Credit Note) Format 9(6) YYMMDD
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).259: Job Time The time at which the job was completed (24Hr) Format 9(4) HHMM
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).260: Job Location The location at which the job was performed in free text Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).261: Glass Repair Potential for glass to be repaired Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).262: Damage Zone The zone in which the damage has occurred Format X
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).263: Size Code The size of the damage area in coded format Format X
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).264: Policy Code Policy qualifications in coded format Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).266: Original Glass The type of glass originally fitted Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).267: Glass Condition Condition of glass at time of job Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).268: Unique copy ID Library acquisitions number which identifies a single copy of a book or publication Format 9(15)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).269: Shelf Mark (or spine label) Applied on the spine label of a book or publication to specify recommended shelf location (libraries) Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).270: Shelving Sequence Specifies shelf sequence of a book or publication (libraries) Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).271: Shelf Filing suffix Specifies shelving location within a classification of a book or publication (libraries) Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).272: Feature Heading An extension applied to the classification of an individual copy of a book or publication to further detail content or shelving (libraries) Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).273: Size Code Specifies a size group or range for a specific application (eg A4 for  paper or Quarto for books) Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).274: Branch Allocation Code Identifies the location to which an item has been allocated Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).275: Replacement Value Used when charging for loss or damage Format 9(10)V9(2)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).276: Availability status of original product, when this has been substituted by an alternative item.
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).277: Time Period To identify a period of time or time band, as previously defined with a trading partner.  Suggested values >1', >2', >3' etc. Format X(3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).278: Percentage of Normal Billing Period Covered By This Bill Format 9(4) with no decimal places. Note: this can be calculated from the bill frequency code (BCD BIFR) and the supply period dates (BCD
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).279: Provisional invoice (not valid for tax purposes) unique reference to allow consolidation to a consolidated tax invoice.  A periodic consolidated tax invoice must follow (either EDI or paper document). Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).280: Surcharge Type Describes the type of surcharges for which an amount is shown in TLR SURT Suggested values are: C - Carriage Charge (VATable); I - Insurance. Format X (3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).282: Returnable asset identification (allocated by the owner of the asset).  Corresponds to EAN data following the application identifier of  8003.  See the ANA's Article Numbering and Symbol Marking Operating Manual for further details. Format X(30)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).283: Serial asset identification (allocated by the owner of the asset).  Corresponds to EAN data following the application identifier of  8004.  See the ANA's Article Numbering and Symbol Marking Operating Manual for further details. Format X(30)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).284: Serial number of a product allocated by the manufacturer. Corresponds to EAN data following the application identifier of 21.  Must be used in conjunction with an applicatoin identifyer of (01).  See the ANA's Article Numbering and Symbol Marking Operating Manual for further details. Format X(20)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).285: When returning items, expected/estimated value of credit.  If the figure can not be calculated automatically, quoted by customer to indicate an expected value. Format 9(10)V9(4)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).286: Time Order Received Used to hold the time this order was received (24 hour).
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).287: Time Pick Note Issued Used to hold the time the pick note was issued for this order (24 hour). Format 9(4) HHMM
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).288: Supplier=s Quotation Line Reference Corresponds to an unique reference, enabling the quotation line to be cited in a customer=s order line or in a subsequent order-related message. Format X(35)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).289: Account Holder Name Code to indicate that the next piece of data is the account holder=s name in text. Format X(30)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).290: Last Payment Date Code to indicate that the next piece of data is the date the last payment was received. Format 9(6) YYMMDD
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).291: Outstanding - Six Month OCC Code to indicate that the next piece of data is a value which represents this. Format 9(8)V9(2)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).292: Unbilled - Six Month OCC Code to indicate that the next piece of data is a value which represents this. Format 9(8)V9(2)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).293: Handset Cost via HSI Code to indicate that the next piece of data is a value which represents this. Format 9(8)V9(2)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).294: Disclosed Cost Price Used in rebate schemes, or when the price notified to an outlet or other location (e.g. on a printed delivery note) differs from the actual price. Format 9(10)V9(4)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).295: Catalogue or Price List Reference A reference to a supplier=s catalogue or price list, from which the product information used in an order was derived. Format X(35)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).296: VAT Breakdown of a mixed rate VAT item reference Used to give advance information to a retailer or wholesaler on the exact VAT breakdown of a mixed-rate item.  For products carrying mixed-rate VAT, this specifies the part of the recommended retail price, excluding VAT, which carries VAT at a rate specified in an associated DNAC field detailed using Code List 12 values. Format  9(10)V9(4)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).297: Delivery Days Indicator To indicate that the next piece of data shows the possible delivery days. The string begins on Monday and the last character represents Sunday.  A Y signifies possible, a N signifies not possible. Format X(7) YNYYNNY
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).298: Telephone Sale/Order Call Time To indicate the time of the telephone call. Format 9(4) HHMM
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).299: Telephone Sale/Order Call Days Indicator To indicate that the next piece of data shows the call days . The string begins on Monday and the last character represents Sunday.  A Y signifies the day a call was made/received.  The rest of the string is filled with character N. Format X(7)NYNNYNN300 Total Number of Pages Used to give the total number of pages in a book or in a set of books sold as a single item. Format 9(6) Variable Length
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).301: Market Restrictions Used to indicate, in free form or in a format agreed between trading partners, geographical restrictions on the sale of a product (e.g. where a publisher or distributor has rights only for a designated set of territories). Format X(40) Variable Length
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).302: Low Stock Indicator Used to carry a code indicating that the supplier currently has low stocks of a product line item. Format X(1)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).303: Delivery Time Window To indicate the possible delivery time slots, giving a choice of two ranges of time. Format 9(16) - HHMMHHMMHHMMHHMM
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).304: SSCC Unique reference to indicate the serial shipping container code for the pallet or container. Format 9(18)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).305: Barrel Conversion Factor Used to convert the sales of traded units to their equivalent barrel. Format 9(3)V9(9)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).306: Alcohol By Volume (ABV) Percentage To define the percentage of alcohol in a product. Format 9(3)V9(3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).307: Ullage Code To identify the type of beer being returned as unsaleable. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).308: Illustrations Note Free text statement of the number and/or type of illustrations in a book or other publication. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).309: Power Factor The ratio of power dissipated to the total power. Format 9(4)V(3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).310: Load Factor The duration in a 24 hour cycle that the power is used, i.e. 12 hours would be 50%. Format 9(4)V(3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).311: Night Unit Percentage The percentage of night units used in proportion to the total usage. Format 9(4)V(3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).312: (BEN) Co-publisher The name of the co-publisher of a book or other publication which is jointly published by two or more organisations. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-5).313: (BEN) Estimated time to manufacture For a book or other publication which is "manufactured on demand", the estimated number of calendar days from receipt of an order to its despatch to the customer. Format 9(2)V

Each block has 3 digit percentage integers, 2 decimal places and 3 digits for the number of days eg. 2.5% within 10 days = 00250010

Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).176: Payment Reference, X (17), the number of the cheque or payment order
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).178: Months in service, 9(2), The number of months since the vehicle was taken onto a leasing scheme
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).179: Charge Type, Code given to define the type of charge, eg Contract Hire, Lease Rental etc.
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).180: Charge Period. Period to which a charge relates
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).181: Charge Comment X(40) Additional text information relating to the charge.
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).182: Concatenated Order Level Totals The totals to be separated by commas Format: 9(3)V9(3), 9(10)V9(2), 9(10)V9(2) Totals to appear in the order: Total Cubic Metres; Total Unit Cost; Total Cost
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).183: Final Delivery Indicator, Format: X(1) Value: 'Y' or 'N'
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).184: Serial Shipping Container Code, Format: 9(18) To identify individual pallets delivered
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).185: Number of Cases, Format: 9(5) To show number of cases on an individual pallet, which may differ from the standard number given in the original order
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).187: Substitute available marker, Format: X(1) Value: 'Y' or 'N'
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).188: Pressurised Systems Legislation: to indicate items for 2 to 7 bar use
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).189: Pressurised Systems Legislation: to indicate items for use below 2 bar
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).190: Cause of problem code The Registered Text field following the code can be used to insert the actual cause of the problem.  Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).191: Contractor's Name The name of the contractor who has completed the work on a vehicle which is then being invoiced to a contract hire company and then re-invoiced to the operating company.
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).192: Contractor's Town Town where the work was carried out
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).193: Voucher Date Date on which the Fleetcard Voucher was completed. Format: 9(6) YYMMDD
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).194: Transaction Reference Reference relating to the original work carried out
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).195: Amended line code Generic code to identify the field(s) which have been amended, ie. change in quantity or price, on an Order or Complex Order amendment message. To aid automatic processing of messages received. The Registered Text field following the code to be used to detail the amendment in plain text for manual processing
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).196: Total Ordered Lines Product lines called off on Picking List Format: 9(10)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).197: Total Ordered Quantity Quantity called off on Picking List Format: 9(15)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).198: Total Received Lines Product lines booked in at warehouse.  Format: 9(10)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).199: Total Received Quantity - Quantity booked in at warehouse Format: 9(15)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).200: In-store price Selling price of an item when this differs from the recommended or marked price. Format 9(10)V9(4)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).201: Gross Profit Percentage Percentage difference between the in-store price and the net cost from the supplier. Format 9(3)V9(3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).202: Best Before End Date (Supplementary Product Data) Format 9(6) YYMMDD
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).206: Invoice Line Reference To hold a consumer's or dealer's reference at line level on an invoice Format X(35) variable length
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).207: Insured's Name The name of the insured party (which may be different to the driver of the vehicle)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).208: Third Party's Name The name of any third party involved with the incident
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).209: Invoice for Period From Format YYMMDD
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).210: Invoice for Period To Format YYMMDD
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).211: Corporate Indicator Indicates whether an order has been placed by a corporate customer or an individual Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).212: Carrier Identity Identifies the carrier of the products ordered by name and/or number Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).213: Due Date for Pickup To inform the supplier and the carrier of the date by which pickup should have occurred Format 9(6) YYMMDD
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).214: >Please quote this message on all documents Used to include a line of text which must be printed by the recipient on any subsequent documentation sent back to the originator of the EDI message. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).217: Delivery Cycle The time of day in which the depot will deliver the stock to the stores.  Suggested values AM or PM Format X(10)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).218: Number of Pallets The total number of pallets on the vehicle Format 9(15)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).220: Special Delivery Instructions To indicate whether pre-booking is required Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).221: Delivery Note Number To reference the relevant Delivery Note Format X(17)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).222: Customer's Own Article Number Where a delivery/uplift is a relationship between a carrier and a retailer/manufacturer, this element pertains to the article ordered from the retailer/manufacturer by the end customer.
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).224: Usual Delivery Point Used to indicate whether a product is delivered by the supplier into the store or into the central warehouse. Suggested values 'S' store delivery, 'W' warehouse delivery. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).225: Energy Supply Zero Rated Reason for zero rate given in format X(40) Suggested values `P' prepaid, `L' low consumption
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).226: Packaging Reference To identify the reference number of the parcel or package into which the line item should be packed. Format X(17).
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).227: Destination Code Indicates that a delivery line is intended for a specific final destination, so cannot be allocated to another destination by the depot. Format X(3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).228: Temperature Regime Indicates the temperature, or temperature range, at which the goods must be stored and handled.  Suggested temperature range codes are as follows: C - Cold Chain (between 0 and 10 C) A - Ambient Format X(3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).229: Delivery Line Number Additional reference for a line on a Delivery Notification.  Used to track goods sent via transshipment locations.  The lines may not be split at the consolidation depot. Format 9(3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).230: Additional Order Specifications Additional specific indication of the type of order, the reason for the order, or special service requirements, where these aspects are not covered by industry code lists. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).231: Special processing Instruction Defines a process to be applied to a product before despatch.  Used in the book trade to cover processing by library suppliers, when industry code lists do not exist.
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).232: Customer Delivery Reference The booking reference for the customer Format X(17)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).235: Substitution Items DUN-14 Code Used for traded units identified by a DUN-14 Code Format 9(14)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).236: Production Week Number Indicates the calendar week that the product will be produced. Format 9(3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).237: Destination Country Use the ISO country code list 3166 Format X(3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).238: Deal Number Unique identifier of a deal Format X(17)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).239: Project Number Unique identifier of a promotional project Format X(17)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).240: Incentive Value Value of the incentive as an amount or a percentage (used with RTEX 241) Format 9(10)V9(4)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).241: Incentive Type Description of type of incentive eg. free gift, buy 10 get 1 free, 10% extra etc. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).242: Agreed Capacity (Electricity Supply) Maximum supply capacity agreed between Host REC and customer within the customer connection agreement. Format 9(6)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).243: KW Monthly Maximum (Electricity Supply) Maximum KW demand recorded in a monthly period.  Usually required during the Host REC's 'peak' period (typically November to February). Format 9(6)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).244: KVA Monthly Maximum (Electricity Supply) Maximum KVA demand recorded within the Host REC's 'peak' period (typically November to February) Format 9(6)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).245: Supply Monthly Maximum (Electricity Supply) Maximum demand within the period covered by the DUoS bill Format 9(6)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).246: Agreed Minimum Chargeable Capacity (Electricity Supply) Minimum supply capacity (for availability charge), agreed between Host REC and customer within the customer connection agreement. Format 9(6)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).247: Months To Run of Minimum Chargeable Capacity Agreement Format 9(2)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).248: Portion Of Month (in 30ths) Covered By This Bill Format 9(2)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).249: Special Labelling Requirement To advise suppliers of special labels or tickets which must be affixed to the goods being supplied Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).250: Returnable Container Used to identify the type of returnable container e.g. tray in which the goods are delivered, stored or transported Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).251: Third Party Delivery Reference Original delivery reference for goods movements between a supplier and a third party such as a haulier or consolidator Format X(17)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).252: Third Party Order Reference Original order reference for goods supplied via a haulier or consolidator Format X(17)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).253: Order Time Time order generated by ordering system.  Used to eliminate duplicate orders. Format 9(6) HHMMSS
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).254: Manufacturer's Recommended Selling Price in quoted currency Format 9(10)V9(4) (formerly code 074)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).255: Net Book Price in quoted currency Format 9(10)V9(4) (formerly code 075)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).256: Third Party Supplier's EAN Location Number Identification of the original supplier of goods delivered by a third party haulier or consolidator.
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).257: Marketing Division Name Identification of the division responsible for a product. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).258: Original Invoice Date Date of original invoice (requested for use in Utility Bill File, when the bill is being used as a Credit Note) Format 9(6) YYMMDD
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).259: Job Time The time at which the job was completed (24Hr) Format 9(4) HHMM
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).260: Job Location The location at which the job was performed in free text Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).261: Glass Repair Potential for glass to be repaired Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).262: Damage Zone The zone in which the damage has occurred Format X
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).263: Size Code The size of the damage area in coded format Format X
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).264: Policy Code Policy qualifications in coded format Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).266: Original Glass The type of glass originally fitted Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).267: Glass Condition Condition of glass at time of job Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).268: Unique copy ID Library acquisitions number which identifies a single copy of a book or publication Format 9(15)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).269: Shelf Mark (or spine label) Applied on the spine label of a book or publication to specify recommended shelf location (libraries) Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).270: Shelving Sequence Specifies shelf sequence of a book or publication (libraries) Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).271: Shelf Filing suffix Specifies shelving location within a classification of a book or publication (libraries) Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).272: Feature Heading An extension applied to the classification of an individual copy of a book or publication to further detail content or shelving (libraries) Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).273: Size Code Specifies a size group or range for a specific application (eg A4 for  paper or Quarto for books) Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).274: Branch Allocation Code Identifies the location to which an item has been allocated Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).275: Replacement Value Used when charging for loss or damage Format 9(10)V9(2)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).276: Availability status of original product, when this has been substituted by an alternative item.
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).277: Time Period To identify a period of time or time band, as previously defined with a trading partner.  Suggested values >1', >2', >3' etc. Format X(3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).278: Percentage of Normal Billing Period Covered By This Bill Format 9(4) with no decimal places. Note: this can be calculated from the bill frequency code (BCD BIFR) and the supply period dates (BCD
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).279: Provisional invoice (not valid for tax purposes) unique reference to allow consolidation to a consolidated tax invoice.  A periodic consolidated tax invoice must follow (either EDI or paper document). Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).280: Surcharge Type Describes the type of surcharges for which an amount is shown in TLR SURT Suggested values are: C - Carriage Charge (VATable); I - Insurance. Format X (3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).282: Returnable asset identification (allocated by the owner of the asset).  Corresponds to EAN data following the application identifier of  8003.  See the ANA's Article Numbering and Symbol Marking Operating Manual for further details. Format X(30)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).283: Serial asset identification (allocated by the owner of the asset).  Corresponds to EAN data following the application identifier of  8004.  See the ANA's Article Numbering and Symbol Marking Operating Manual for further details. Format X(30)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).284: Serial number of a product allocated by the manufacturer. Corresponds to EAN data following the application identifier of 21.  Must be used in conjunction with an applicatoin identifyer of (01).  See the ANA's Article Numbering and Symbol Marking Operating Manual for further details. Format X(20)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).285: When returning items, expected/estimated value of credit.  If the figure can not be calculated automatically, quoted by customer to indicate an expected value. Format 9(10)V9(4)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).286: Time Order Received Used to hold the time this order was received (24 hour).
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).287: Time Pick Note Issued Used to hold the time the pick note was issued for this order (24 hour). Format 9(4) HHMM
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).288: Supplier=s Quotation Line Reference Corresponds to an unique reference, enabling the quotation line to be cited in a customer=s order line or in a subsequent order-related message. Format X(35)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).289: Account Holder Name Code to indicate that the next piece of data is the account holder=s name in text. Format X(30)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).290: Last Payment Date Code to indicate that the next piece of data is the date the last payment was received. Format 9(6) YYMMDD
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).291: Outstanding - Six Month OCC Code to indicate that the next piece of data is a value which represents this. Format 9(8)V9(2)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).292: Unbilled - Six Month OCC Code to indicate that the next piece of data is a value which represents this. Format 9(8)V9(2)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).293: Handset Cost via HSI Code to indicate that the next piece of data is a value which represents this. Format 9(8)V9(2)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).294: Disclosed Cost Price Used in rebate schemes, or when the price notified to an outlet or other location (e.g. on a printed delivery note) differs from the actual price. Format 9(10)V9(4)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).295: Catalogue or Price List Reference A reference to a supplier=s catalogue or price list, from which the product information used in an order was derived. Format X(35)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).296: VAT Breakdown of a mixed rate VAT item reference Used to give advance information to a retailer or wholesaler on the exact VAT breakdown of a mixed-rate item.  For products carrying mixed-rate VAT, this specifies the part of the recommended retail price, excluding VAT, which carries VAT at a rate specified in an associated DNAC field detailed using Code List 12 values. Format  9(10)V9(4)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).297: Delivery Days Indicator To indicate that the next piece of data shows the possible delivery days. The string begins on Monday and the last character represents Sunday.  A Y signifies possible, a N signifies not possible. Format X(7) YNYYNNY
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).298: Telephone Sale/Order Call Time To indicate the time of the telephone call. Format 9(4) HHMM
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).299: Telephone Sale/Order Call Days Indicator To indicate that the next piece of data shows the call days . The string begins on Monday and the last character represents Sunday.  A Y signifies the day a call was made/received.  The rest of the string is filled with character N. Format X(7)NYNNYNN300 Total Number of Pages Used to give the total number of pages in a book or in a set of books sold as a single item. Format 9(6) Variable Length
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).301: Market Restrictions Used to indicate, in free form or in a format agreed between trading partners, geographical restrictions on the sale of a product (e.g. where a publisher or distributor has rights only for a designated set of territories). Format X(40) Variable Length
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).302: Low Stock Indicator Used to carry a code indicating that the supplier currently has low stocks of a product line item. Format X(1)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).303: Delivery Time Window To indicate the possible delivery time slots, giving a choice of two ranges of time. Format 9(16) - HHMMHHMMHHMMHHMM
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).304: SSCC Unique reference to indicate the serial shipping container code for the pallet or container. Format 9(18)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).305: Barrel Conversion Factor Used to convert the sales of traded units to their equivalent barrel. Format 9(3)V9(9)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).306: Alcohol By Volume (ABV) Percentage To define the percentage of alcohol in a product. Format 9(3)V9(3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).307: Ullage Code To identify the type of beer being returned as unsaleable. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).308: Illustrations Note Free text statement of the number and/or type of illustrations in a book or other publication. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).309: Power Factor The ratio of power dissipated to the total power. Format 9(4)V(3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).310: Load Factor The duration in a 24 hour cycle that the power is used, i.e. 12 hours would be 50%. Format 9(4)V(3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).311: Night Unit Percentage The percentage of night units used in proportion to the total usage. Format 9(4)V(3)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).312: (BEN) Co-publisher The name of the co-publisher of a book or other publication which is jointly published by two or more organisations. Format X(40)
Registered Text Code (RTEX-7).313: (BEN) Estimated time to manufacture For a book or other publication which is "manufactured on demand", the estimated number of calendar days from receipt of an order to its despatch to the customer. Format 9(2)V
